com.netflix.spectator.http

Class RxHttp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.http.RxHttp

  • @Singleton
public final class RxHttp
extends Object
    Helper for some simple uses of rxnetty with eureka. Only intended for use within the spectator plugin.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RxHttp(ServerRegistry serverRegistry)
      Create a new instance using the specified server registry.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RxHttp

        @Inject
public RxHttp(ServerRegistry serverRegistry)
        Create a new instance using the specified server registry. Calls using client side load-balancing (niws:// or vip:// URIs) need a server registry to lookup the set of servers to balance over.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        @PostConstruct
public void start()
        Setup the background tasks for cleaning up connections.

      • stop

        @PreDestroy
public void stop()
        Shutdown all connections that are currently open.

      • submit

        public iep.rx.Observable<iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.

      • submit

        public iep.rx.Observable<iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req,
                                                                                                                         String entity)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        entity - Content data or null if no content is needed for the request body.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.

      • submit

        public iep.rx.Observable<iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(iep.io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req,
                                                                                                                         byte[] entity)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        entity - Content data or null if no content is needed for the request body.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.
